intro: Pseudoeriosema bequaertii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, hairy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the warmer months. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
